metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5139 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in the opj_tcd_init_tile function in tcd.c inOpenJPEG, as used in PDFium in Google Chrome before 52.0.2743.116, allowremote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow)or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JPEG 2000 data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5139` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-browser-l10n - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-chromedriver - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
No subscription required

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250').
openjpeg2 package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1').
